title: Developing vector graphics
summary: Create digital artwork using shapes, paths and layers — with a focus on precision and design choices.
intro: Vector graphics are made from shapes and paths, so they stay sharp at any size. Perfect for logos, icons, and anything that shouldn’t turn into pixel soup.
learningGoals: Use shapes and lines to build images
Organise work using layers and grouping
Choose colours, fonts and alignment with purpose
mastery: Create a logo/icon that meets a brief
Export correctly (size, file type, transparent background)

lessons.title: Using vector tools to draw and modify shapes
lessons.outcome: I can use software to draw and modify vector shapes.

lessons.title: Working with multiple objects
lessons.outcome: I can work with multiple objects to create a vector drawing.

lessons.title: Vector paths
lessons.outcome: I can edit the paths of vector shapes to create unique shapes.

lessons.title: Developing a vector product
lessons.outcome: I can plan and design a vector product for a given project.

lessons.title: Vector markup
lessons.outcome: I can investigate the markup of a vector graphic and change an object by modifying its markup.

lessons.title: Comparing bitmap and vector graphics
lessons.outcome: I can compare vector and bitmap images and consider which image type best suits which situation.
